contentList.content:
Feat: Strike of the Giants

You were raised among giants or sheltered by them and bear traces of their culture. You gain the Strike of the Giants feat when you take this background: choose one giant strike. The chosen strike grants a pool of charges that refresh on a long rest and lets you channel elemental effects through a weapon attack. You also know giant lore and gestures that mark you as kin to those titans.

If you take this Background you are not meant to take the Strike of the Giants Feat at any other level.
Feature: Strike of the Giants (bonus feat granted by this background).

Feat: Rune Shaper

You studied giant runecraft and can inscribe runes onto objects. You gain Comprehend Languages (free 1/long rest), then choose runes equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down). Each rune teaches you a 1st-level spell you can cast with slots or invoke free once per long rest. Pick Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting ability.

If you take this Background you are not meant to take the Rune Carver Feat at any other level.
Feature: Rune Shaper (bonus feat granted by this background).

You channel the primeval might of giants into your blows. When you gain this feat, pick one giant strike; its charges refresh on a long rest and empower your weapon attacks with potent elemental effects.

This will unlock a "Giant Strike Choice" ability that will let you choose from 6 elemental variations of the giants strike.
Charges: expend one charge to empower a weapon attack with the chosen giant strike. Charges recover after a long rest.
Resource that fuels your chosen Strike of the Giants option.

When you gain this feat, select one giant strike. Each strike augments a weapon attack with an elemental surge and a secondary effect (damage, control, or movement). Choose the one that best fits your tactics.
Toggle the saving throw tied to your strike effects to better match your build.

Thunder roils through your strike. On a failed Wisdom save the target is disoriented — all attack rolls against the character suffer disadvantage until the start of your next turn. A successful save halves or reduces the effect as noted by the ability.
Attacks are made with disadvantage while the storm haze lingers.
Ignite your weapon with giant-forged flame. The strike deals bonus fire damage and may apply a brief visual scorch or secondary effect; damage scales as described by the feat.
Wreathe your blow in frigid might. The strike deals cold damage and can immobilize the target on a failed Constitution save; the freeze is brief but can shift control of the battlefield.
Bring hill giant might to bear with your weapon; on a failed Strength save the foe is knocked prone.
Strike with stone-shattering force; on a failed Strength save the target is shoved back.
Crash down with storm lightning; on a failed save the target's attacks falter. Toggle the save stat in the feat.
Attack rolls are made with disadvantage after the storm's shock.
Storm Strike uses Constitution instead of Strength for its saving throw.
You have chosen your Strike of the Giants option.

You've studied the magic of Giant runes. You learn Comprehend Languages (free 1/long rest) and can inscribe runes onto objects. Choose a number of runes equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up). Each inscribed rune teaches you a 1st-level spell that you can cast with spell slots or invoke free once per long rest.

Spell Save DC = 8 + Proficiency Bonus + chosen ability modifier.
Invoke an inscribed rune to cast its spell without expending a spell slot. Each rune can be invoked once per long rest.
Select the mental ability (Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma) that fuels your rune spells.

Use Intelligence for Rune Shaper spell DCs and attack rolls.
Spell Save DC = 8 + Proficiency + Intelligence modifier.

Use Wisdom for Rune Shaper spell DCs and attack rolls.
Spell Save DC = 8 + Proficiency + Wisdom modifier.

Use Charisma for Rune Shaper spell DCs and attack rolls.
Spell Save DC = 8 + Proficiency + Charisma modifier.

Inscribe your chosen runes onto objects to learn their associated spells. Pick your casting ability and select runes equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down). Each rune grants a 1st-level spell you can cast with slots or invoke free once per long rest.
Reeling from thunder - Disadvantage on Attack Rolls until the start of the attacker's next turn.
Rooted by frost - Speed reduced to 0 until the start of the attacker's next turn.
Shocked by lightning - Disadvantage on Saving Throws until the start of the attacker's next turn.

You have manifested the fiery combat emblematic of fire giants, granting fire resistance and a powerful Searing Ignition ability.

Only choose this feat if you have the Flame Strike from Strike of the Giants.
You have resistance to fire damage.

Searing Ignition — Instead of making a normal attack, unleash a 15 ft burst of flame. Creatures in the area must succeed on a Dexterity save or suffer 1d8 + your Proficiency Bonus fire damage and be Blinded until the start of your next turn; on a successful save they take half damage. Use one charge.

You have manifested the icy might emblematic of frost giants, granting cold resistance and a Frigid Retaliation reaction.

Only choose this feat if you have the Frost Strike from Strike of the Giants.
You have resistance to cold damage.

Frigid Retaliation — When an enemy hits you and is within 30 ft, you can use a reaction to unleash an icy blast. The attacker must make a Constitution save or take 1d8 + your Proficiency Bonus cold damage and have their speed reduced to 0 until the end of their next turn; a successful save halves the damage and negates the movement effect. Costs one charge.

You have manifested the confounding magic emblematic of cloud giants, granting a Cloudy Escape reaction.

Only choose this feat if you have the Cloud Strike from Strike of the Giants.
When an attack hits you, use a reaction to become a gaseous cloud, gaining resistance to all damage until your next turn. While in this form, you can use Misty Step (30ft range) for free.
Teleport up to 30ft to an unoccupied space you can see. Using this ends your gaseous form.

You have manifested the physical talents emblematic of stone giants, granting improved darkvision and a Stone Throw attack.

Only choose this feat if you have the Stone Strike from Strike of the Giants.
You gain darkvision with a range of 60ft. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 60ft.

Stone Throw — As a bonus action, hurl a magical stone up to long range that deals 1d10 force damage on hit. A struck creature must make a Strength save or be knocked Prone. The stone is enhanced by your stoneborn might; using this ability consumes a charge.

You have manifested the tempest magic emblematic of storm giants, granting a powerful Maelstrom Aura.

Only choose this feat if you have the Lightning Strike from Strike of the Giants.

Maelstrom Aura — As a bonus action, conjure a whirling aura of wind and lightning around you for one turn. You gain resistance to lightning and thunder, attacks against you suffer disadvantage, and creatures that start their turn within 10 ft must make a Strength save or have their speed halved while the aura persists. Activating the aura consumes a charge.

You have manifested the resilience emblematic of hill giants, granting Bulwark and Iron Stomach abilities.

Only choose this feat if you have the Hill Strike from Strike of the Giants.

Bulwark — When an effect would push you or knock you prone, expend a reaction and a charge to brace yourself. You instead resist the forced movement or falling prone, remaining upright and secure against the effect.

Iron Stomach — During a short rest, when you consume food and spend Hit Dice, you regain additional hit points equal to your Constitution modifier plus your Proficiency Bonus. Your hardy digestion reflects hill-giant resilience.
Cast Comprehend Languages once per long rest without a spell slot.
Inscribe the Cloud rune to learn Fog Cloud. You can cast it with spell slots or invoke the rune once per long rest for free.
Inscribe the Death rune to learn Inflict Wounds. You can cast it with spell slots or invoke the rune once per long rest for free.
Inscribe the Dragon rune to learn Chromatic Orb. You can cast it with spell slots or invoke the rune once per long rest for free.
Inscribe the Enemy rune to learn Disguise Self. You can cast it with spell slots or invoke the rune once per long rest for free.
Inscribe the Fire rune to learn Burning Hands. You can cast it with spell slots or invoke the rune once per long rest for free.
Inscribe the Friend rune to learn Speak with Animals. You can cast it with spell slots or invoke the rune once per long rest for free.
Inscribe the Frost rune to learn Armor of Agathys. You can cast it with spell slots or invoke the rune once per long rest for free.
Inscribe the Hill rune to learn Goodberry. You can cast it with spell slots or invoke the rune once per long rest for free.
Inscribe the Journey rune to learn Longstrider. You can cast it with spell slots or invoke the rune once per long rest for free.
Inscribe the King rune to learn Command. You can cast it with spell slots or invoke the rune once per long rest for free.
Inscribe the Mountain rune to learn Entangle. You can cast it with spell slots or invoke the rune once per long rest for free.
Inscribe the Stone rune to learn Sanctuary. You can cast it with spell slots or invoke the rune once per long rest for free.
Inscribe the Storm rune to learn Thunderwave. You can cast it with spell slots or invoke the rune once per long rest for free.
Cast Fog Cloud once per long rest by invoking your inscribed Cloud rune.
Cast Inflict Wounds once per long rest by invoking your inscribed Death rune.
Cast Chromatic Orb once per long rest by invoking your inscribed Dragon rune.
Cast Disguise Self once per long rest by invoking your inscribed Enemy rune.
Cast Burning Hands once per long rest by invoking your inscribed Fire rune.
Cast Speak with Animals once per long rest by invoking your inscribed Friend rune.
Cast Armor of Agathys once per long rest by invoking your inscribed Frost rune.
Cast Goodberry once per long rest by invoking your inscribed Hill rune.
Cast Longstrider once per long rest by invoking your inscribed Journey rune.
Cast Command once per long rest by invoking your inscribed King rune.
Cast Entangle once per long rest by invoking your inscribed Mountain rune.
Cast Sanctuary once per long rest by invoking your inscribed Stone rune.
Cast Thunderwave once per long rest by invoking your inscribed Storm rune.
